title: Villages Near Nepal Earthquake’s Epicenter Are Desperate as Death Toll Tops 3,800
description: Residents of Gorkha district say houses collapsed, food is running out and so far no one has arrived with aid.

title: New Study Links Weather Extremes to Global Warming
description: Human emissions are responsible for about 75 percent of especially hot days and 18 percent of unusually heavy precipitation, according to a new report.

title: The Appraisal: Congregants Challenge Sale of Bulwark of Judaism on Lower East Side
description: Worshipers at the Home of the Sages charge in court that a $13 million deal is motivated by self-enrichment, with proceeds largely flowing to the synagogue’s president.

title: Freddie Gray Is Mourned at Funeral in Baltimore
description: Thousands of people turned out to pay their respects to Mr. Gray, whose death on April 19 after an encounter with the police has opened a deep wound in Baltimore.

title: President of Sudan Is Re-elected With 94 Percent of Vote
description: President Omar Hassan al-Bashir of Sudan won a race that was boycotted by the opposition and marred by low voter turnout.

title: Tsarnaev’s Lawyers Focus on Chaotic Upbringing in Case Against Death Penalty
description: The defense faces a challenge as it tries to persuade the jury that Mr. Tsarnaev was a good teenager who was heavy influenced by his older brother.

title: Scott Walker Is Said to Take a Long View in 2016 Strategy
description: Advisers and donors to the Wisconsin governor, a likely Republican candidate for president, say he has put plans in motion that cede early fund-raising momentum to his chief rival, Jeb Bush.

title: Latest News: Nepal Aftershocks, Colorado Trial, Laika the Space Dog
description: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

title: Greece Says It Is Changing Team That Negotiates With Creditors
description: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras is putting officials in charge of day-to-day talks who are less polarizing than Finance Minister Yanis Varoufakis.

title: First Draft: Gay Businessman Who Hosted Ted Cruz Event Apologizes
description: Ian Reisner, one of the two gay hoteliers facing boycott calls for hosting an event for Senator Ted Cruz, who is adamantly opposed to same-sex marriage, said he had shown “poor judgment.”

title: Rinaldo Ardizoia, the Oldest Living Yankee, Reflects on His Career
description: Ardizoia, 95, a pitcher who appeared in just one major league game, attended Joe DiMaggio’s wedding, gave a helping hand to Babe Ruth and spent a season playing for Casey Stengel in the minors.

title: The Parched West: Drought Frames Economic Divide of Californians
description: The persistent water shortage is illustrating parallel worlds in which wealthy communities guzzle water as poorer neighbors conserve by necessity.

title: A Son of Football Calls His Mother
description: Born into a football family in a football-first community, Patrick Risha became a star on the gridiron. But after he graduated from Dartmouth, there were signs that something was off.

title: Climbers Describe Havoc on Mount Everest After Nepal Earthquake
description: As rescue efforts were hampered by bad weather, dramatic details emerged about the devastation at the base camp in the wake of an avalanche.

title: South Korea’s Premier Resigns After Claims He Took an Illegal Cash Gift
description: Lee Wan-koo, the second prime minister to step down under President Park Geun-hye, denied that he had received the money, but calls mounted for his resignation.

title: Lawyers Seek Sea Change on Gay Rights at Supreme Court
description: Those arguing against states’ bans on same-sex marriage hope the justices will reach a bold verdict that would transform the status of gay Americans.

title: City Room: New York Today: The Artist Was Present
description: Monday: A Park Slope mystery solved, a gray day, and Ulysses S. Grant’s birthday.

title: First Draft: Today in Politics: Rand Paul Goes to New York to Coax a Wary Bloc
description: Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky continues to seek to ease some conservatives’ concerns over his positions on Israel.

title: Kazakhstan’s President Is Re-elected by Almost Every Voter
description: Nursultan A. Nazarbayev, who has governed the country since the Soviet Union collapsed, secured his fifth term with 97.7 percent of the vote.

title: Updates on the Response to the Disaster
description: New York Times correspondents and videographers in Nepal are covering the rescue and relief efforts.
